text:
My 12 favorite problems/questions:
Last tended Nov 5, 2023


How can I truly help out the low-income BIPOC community?
How can I continue to represent my culture in very dense environments?
What do I owe to the land around me?
How can we get data to be a true representation of our communities?
How will I determine that I’ve done “enough”?
What truly is success to me?
How can I balance my life back home and my college life?
How can I both uplift and listen to new voices and silence voices?
Where can I find happiness in such hard moments?
Is my criticism objective or subjective?
How can I succeed when I walking against social standards
Am I losing myself to new ideas/ways of thinking? or just growing?

title: Macalester College student Majors
text:
In collaboration with a team of applied mathematicians, statisticians, and art historians and curators, I used data science and machine learning tools to estimate the diversity of artists at 18 U.S. art museums. The project goal was to make inferences about artist characteristics to summarize the diversity of a museum’s collection.
We performed data collection by web scraping information about the collections at the chosen art museums, designed the sampling method to create a subset of artists to focus on, and created a website that provides access to our final data set as well as graphical summaries for broad access to our results.
This work has been covered in international news outlets including the San Francisco Chronicle, Smithsonian Magazine, The Guardian (UK), Minnesota Public Radio, and MIT Technology Review.
**Products**
- Presentation: <file:///Users/aliciaseveriano/Documents/First-Year/Fall%202022/COMP_STAT_112/Final%20Share-2/try2.html#/title-slide>

title: Elinai Alicia Severiano Perez
text:
I love working with data, specifically to make findings/visuals much more understandable for everyone. Feel free to check out my Projects tab to learn more about my skills and my work.


Macalester College | St. Paul MN  Majors in Data Science and Educational Studies | Expected Graduation Date: Spring 2026



I am from Bensenville, Illinois. Prior to college, I danced Mexican Ballet Folklorico for six years, which still holds a special place in my heart. My culture and roots are really important to me, and I try to showcase it as much as possible. My picture was taken before a Latinx showcase at my college this past year, where I danced Folklorico one last time.*
Outside of coding, I also strive to work on creating a safe and welcoming environment for students like me: BIPOC, Low-Income, Latina, and children of immigrants.
If you want to get an idea of what I am constantly thinking click on my Questions tab to see what questions linger on my mind daily.



Email: aseveria@macalester.edu
